page.title: 01PORTRAIT OF HOLYWELL
page.content: The town of Holywell,with a population of 9000 is situated on a hillside {commanding sweeping views}of the Dee Estuary,the Halkyn Mountain Range and the Clwydian Hills.The bracing sea and mountain air and its position which gives easy access to the beautiful city of Chester,the popular N.Wales seaside resorts and quiet country scenes makes it a{pleasant residential {centre.}It is a nucleated town and its High Street has retained its Georgian character-this will be retained within the new proposed developments.The pop- ulation is housed in large private or council estates with only a few large properties standing in their own grounds.The climate varies so much that crops planted at the same time on high and low ground can be harvested at different times.
